page.title: 11THE NATIONAL WIRELESS MUSEUM
page.content: This museum is at Arreton Manor on the Isle of Wight. It has a unique collection of vintage wireless receivers dating back to the first World War. Here can be seen crystal sets with cats-whiskers and headphones, antique receivers with "bright-emitter" valves, and curved horn loudspeakers - as used when broadcasting from 2LO which commenced in 1922. Dozens of period components are shown, as used by home-constructors, and there are wireless periodicals popular over half a century ago. Later exhibits include so-called "portable" sets of truely gargantuan proportions - and weight! - also the luxury consoles and radiograms of the thirties.
